lead_paragraph: A jury in Boston found against Notre Dame Coach Charlie Weis yesterday in his malpractice lawsuit against two doctors he said botched his care after he had gastric bypass surgery five years ago.The jury deliberated a few hours before finding that the Massachusetts General Hospital surgeons Charles Ferguson and Richard Hodin were not negligent.Weis, 51, who was the offensive coordinator for the New England Patriots when the team won three Super Bowls earlier this decade, accused the surgeons of negligence, saying they allowed him to bleed internally for 30 hours before performing a second operation to correct the complication. Weis nearly died after the operation in 2002. Ferguson and Hodin said internal bleeding was a well-known complication of the surgery. They said they believed the bleeding would stop and were concerned about a second operation because of the risk of a pulmonary embolism.
